oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Freddie Hart interview - Biff Collie Nashville House Party - 1975-06-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Freddie Hart (performer/songwriter), conducted by Biff Collie on Nashville House Party on June 9, 1975.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Freddie Hart -- Freddie Hart talks about his first song Butterfly Love and his first hit record Loose Talk -- Hart talks about Keys In The Mailbox -- Hart introduces Marty Robbins -- Hart talks about separating from his wife in 1970 and then releasing Easy Lovin' and breaking the record in Atlanta, GA. -- Hart talks about how great things have been and having 11 number one hit records -- Hart introduces George Jones -- Hart talks about having 11 number ones -- Hart talks about have 2 sons -- Hart talks about living in Burbank, CA., but still spending a lot of time in Nashville -- Hart talks about wanting to appear in television specials -- Hart talks about enjoying playing jamborees -- Hart recites a pre-written skit with an audience member named Jack Wagner -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Hart talks about his record The Whole World Holding Hands and being fine with displaying compassion to others -- Biff Collie concludes the interview (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hart, Freddie; Collie, Biff;
